p: The next most abundant terpene, caryophyllene has the ability to both prevent and cure malaria. Caryophyllene is an active component of insect repellents especially for mosquitoes and other blood-feeding Diptera (Maia and Sarah 2011). Recent studies ensured that silver nanoparticles synthesized from caryophyllene are highly effective against (Kamaraj et al. 2017). Thus, terpenes could be a safer and a cost effective alternative for malarial treatment.
